abstracts.cdata!:
The Power Sector Efficiency Improvement
            Project's outcome is rated as highly satisfactory. The
            success of the project's main component, the Ghom
            Combined Cycle Power Plant, and dramatic improvements to
            Tehran Regional Electricity Company's (TREC) financial
            management can be attributed to a well-designed project
            implemented by a Project Implementation Unit (PIU) with a
            high level of project management capability together with
            continuity of the PIU staff, continuity of Bank supervision
            staff, and the spirit of cooperation between the TREC and
            the Bank. Invariably, shifts in management and staff on both
            the Borrower and Bank sides result in setbacks. Another
            contributing factor to the project's success was the
            use of local expertise to upgrade the Borrower's
            financial management capability. The software elements of
            the project received less attention than its physical
            components. In general, policy and institutional aspects are
            often put on hold pending endorsement by decision makers at
            high levels. The Middle East and North Africa Region should
            have a coherent and comprehensive supervision strategy that
            would aim to ensure that policy and institutional objectives
            in all Bank-assisted projects in the Region's portfolio
            are satisfied.
